name: places/ChIJF3MI6RdawokREQvv88gkP6I
formattedAddress: 90 William St # 1, New York, NY 10038, USA
adrFormatAddress: 90 William St # 1, New York, NY 10038-5046, USA

originalText.text:
I would give zero stars if I could. I have never written one of these reviews before but felt compelled to make this known. Back in November my friends who are apartment owners at this building, got married. I was away and sent a bottle of vintage Dom Perignon to them for their wedding day brunch. The liquor store absolutely delivered it and had a confirmation, but they never received it. When they inquired, the doorman told them their next door neighbor took it and were on vacation for the next week. When the neighbor returned from vacation they did confirm the doorman attempted to give it to them but they did not accept the package because it was not their name on it. There was a giant card on the bag with the unit owners names. The SAME doorman now said it should be in the package room. It wasn't.

No one could find it or even try to rectify this situation. My friends were ignored by their own building management. Finally, in December I found the contact for the building manager, Tamer Kayacan. He told me they could not confirm the location of the bottle because there are no cameras in the package room. Clearly, the bottle was stolen. He apologized and said they would reimburse me since it was a $300 bottle. That was before Christmas. I provided my contact information, and attached a receipt. I followed up on January 2, and January 5th he said he would check on the status of my check. That is the last I heard from him and his associate, Shef Ndregjoni. I have sent four more emails, and now the unit owners are trying to rectify with the building board.

Almost five months trying to rectify this and receive a check that I was offered by management because their building staff actually stole from the tenants. This is incredibly unprofessional on so many levels, and quite sad that the staff cannot be trusted to handle the packages for the building. It was an expensive bottle of champagne but it is more the lack of respect to the tenants, and myself that is really disappointing. This management company is irresponsible, rude, and incompetent. They have hired untrustworthy staff, and because of it my friends were going back and forth on their wedding for a missing package rather than celebrating (and still trying to get answers for this), and I still have not received a check this is owed to me. It is absolutely appalling and poor business practice.

originalText.text: I went to for delivery this morning and the doorman  with the eye glasses is not friendly and the way he talked  to me its really unprofessional and rude he need to learn how to treat everyone the same way!!
